column12: Apparatuses and methods for anterior cervical transarticular fixation
column13: In one embodiment, an anterior cervical transarticular fixation implant including a cervical plate including a central body, lateral wings that extend laterally outward from the central body, each lateral wing including a fastener opening configured to receive a fastener configured to thread into vertebrae, and locking mechanisms configured to selectively lock the fasteners in place.
column14: LAM KENRICK CHUR WEI;;DESAI SOHUM;;BRANCH DANIEL WILLIAMS;;UNIV TEXAS
column15: LAM KENRICK CHUR-WEI;;DESAI SOHUM;;BRANCH DANIEL WILLIAMS
column16: THE BOARD OF REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS SYSTEM (2018-02-22)
column32: Kerschbaumer, et al., “Transoral decompression, anterior plate fixation, and posterior wire fusion for Irreducible Atlantoaxial kyphosis in rheumatoid arthritis”, SPINE vol. 25, No. 20, 2000.;;Kim, et al., “Biomechanical comparison of anterior and posterior stabilization methods in atlantoaxial instability”, J. Neurosurg (Spine 3) 100, 2004.;;Koller, et al., “Anterior retropharyngeal fixation C1-2 for stabilization of atlantozxial instabilities: study of feasiblity, technical description and preliminary results”, Eur Spine J 15, 2006.;;Platzer, et al., “Plate fixation of odontoid fractures without C1-C2 arthrodesis: practice of a novel surgical technique for stabilization of odontoid fractures, including the opportunity to extend the fixation to C3”, Clinical studies, vol. 64, No. 4, Apr. 2009.;;Reindl, et al., “Anterior instrumentation for traumatic C1-C2 Instability”, Spine vol. 28, No. 17, 2003.;;Cai, et al., “Evaluation of biomechanical properties of anterior atlantoaxial transarticular locking plate system using three-dimensional finite element analysis”, Eur Spine J., 2013.
